awd_abstract_narration:
This project is to organize and execute the annual principal investigator (PI) meeting for the National Robotics Initiative (NRI). The workshop will bring together all the PIs engaged in the NRI for a two day workshop to discuss research, educational initiatives, and methods for transition of results. 

The workshop includes oral presentations by involved program managers, the PIs, a poster session with presentation of all sponsored projects, tutorials, and several keynote speeches. An important aspect of the workshop is program-wide networking and exploration of mechanisms to optimize the results of the overall initiative with respect to research, training, and societal impact.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The NRI has been launched to pursue the scientific vision of co-robots --
 systems that assist people in their daily lives at work, at
home, and during leisure. The challenge of designing systems for these
applications involves a broad set of disciplines from materials to
artificial intelligence and cognitive science. Most projects cannot
cover all of these disciplines. Consequently, it is of interest to
leverage the annual PI meeting to facilitate cross-dissemination of
results across projects and to illustrate examples of best-practices.

This year's PI meeting featured three poster sessions with over 160
posters presented in total.  Many of the posters are available online
on the meeting's web site (http://nri2015.ri.cmu.edu/posters).  This
year, we instituted a policy that required positive confirmation prior
to posting the posters online, so only those who responded to our
request for posting permission are available online. 

The meeting also featured rapid fire presentations by all of the
current NRI grantees -- 115 presentations total.  Each grantee was
given a two minute slot to
share an overview of the goals and recent results of their project.
Together with the coordinating poster sessions and social time during
meals and breaks, these presentations facilitated the meeting's goal
of sharing NRI research achievements among the grantees and
participating government agencies.  These presentations were also
shared with the NSF and the other NRI agencies.

In addition, some groups took advantage of the convergence of PIs to
hold separate strategic meetings for specific agencies, such as the USDA.


Last Modified: 02/12/2016
Modified by: Daniel Huber
